comments:
build I20040310

- was stepping through some code
- it paused for a while
- the Debug view then changed to show the target as being terminated
  - actually the process is still there and not indicating <terminated>, but 
the Main thread shows <disconnected> and all other threads are gone
- however, the target did not actually terminate, it just lost the connection 
from the debugger

The net here has felt really sluggish this evening, which might explain the 
timeouts in the log below.

Note that the last one is a VMDisconnectedException, not a TimeoutException.

The <disconnected> and lack of <terminated> were accurate indications of what 
was going on.  The problem is just that the connection was lost.
Is there any way of reconnecting to a target when this happens?

There is no way to reconnect in this case. We would have to launch the target 
VM as a server accepting a connection, as you do when you want to attach to a 
remote (already running) VM. I'm going to defer this as a feature request. 
However, this should be a very rare occurrence. 

I don't think there is anything we can do to avoid the disconnect - the 
debugger behaved as it is designed to (i.e. tell you it disconnected). One 
thing to try when there are many timeouts, is to increase the debugger 
communication timeout preference, on the "Java > Debug" preference page.
